message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.DB. 

The paper focuses on question answering based on knowledge bases, which is a common topic in natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR) research. The use of context information, such as entity type and out-degree, is also a common technique in NLP and IR. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval) are both likely sub-categories. The paper also proposes a framework that uses self-attention mechanisms and multi-task learning, which are common techniques in machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) research, suggesting cs.AI as another likely sub-category. The paper also involves working with knowledge bases, which are often stored in databases, suggesting cs.DB as a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves experimental evaluation of the proposed approach, which is a common practice in machine learning and data mining research, suggesting cs.LG (Machine Learning) as a possible sub-category.
